channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: ICC charges former Philippine President Duterte crimes against humanity
item.description: Duterte was arrested in March by Philippine authorities on a warrant issued by the ICC. He is now being held at an ICC facility in the Netherlands.
item.content:encoded:
Duterte was arrested in March by Philippine authorities on a warrant issued by the ICC. He is now being held at an ICC facility in the Netherlands.

(Image credit: Bullit Marquez/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump suggests unproven tie between Tylenol and autism. And, Jimmy Kimmel returns
item.description: President Trump linked the active ingredient in Tylenol to autism, but science doesn't back his claim. And, Jimmy Kimmel Live! returns to the air tonight.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump linked the active ingredient in Tylenol to autism, but science doesn't back his claim. And, Jimmy Kimmel Live! returns to the air tonight.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Did Amazon trick people into paying for Prime? Federal case goes to trial
item.description: The U.S. government says Amazon manipulated people into signing up for Prime memberships that were purposefully hard to cancel. The company says its designs and disclosures follow industry standards.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. government says Amazon manipulated people into signing up for Prime memberships that were purposefully hard to cancel. The company says its designs and disclosures follow industry standards.

(Image credit: Leon Neal)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: How to reintegrate over a million veterans? Groups in Ukraine are working on it
item.description: Many Ukrainian war veterans have physical and mental trauma, and struggle to return to civilian life. Here is a look at some groups trying to help ease them back into the community.
item.content:encoded:
Many Ukrainian war veterans have physical and mental trauma, and struggle to return to civilian life. Here is a look at some groups trying to help ease them back into the community.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Claire Harbage

item.title: 5 takeaways from Kamala Harris' new book about her sprint for the presidency
item.description: Former Vice President Kamala Harris writes about her brief run for the presidency last year and her relationship with former President Joe Biden in her new book, out on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
Former Vice President Kamala Harris writes about her brief run for the presidency last year and her relationship with former President Joe Biden in her new book, out on Tuesday.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Georgia senators demand answers on more than a dozen deaths in immigration detention
item.description: Sens. Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock are asking Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem for answers after more than a dozen people died in immigration detention, as the department rushes to expand.
item.content:encoded:
Sens. Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock are asking Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem for answers after more than a dozen people died in immigration detention, as the department rushes to expand.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Judge orders Trump administration to restore $500 million in grant funding to UCLA
item.description: A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to restore $500 million in federal grant funding that it froze at the University of California, Los Angeles.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to restore $500 million in federal grant funding that it froze at the University of California, Los Angeles.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel will be back on air on Tuesday, but not all stations will carry it
item.description: The late night comic was suspended last week under pressure from the Trump administration after comments about Charlie Kirk's killing.
item.content:encoded:
The late night comic was suspended last week under pressure from the Trump administration after comments about Charlie Kirk's killing.

(Image credit: Ronald Martinez)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Unease grows at the Justice Department as Trump's threats get even more blunt
item.description: President Trump is directing the Justice Department to prosecute his perceived political enemies, upending the career ranks and raising questions about selective prosecution.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is directing the Justice Department to prosecute his perceived political enemies, upending the career ranks and raising questions about selective prosecution.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: July 4 wildfire in Grand Canyon still burning, questions about response still unanswered
item.description: The Dragon Bravo fire continues to burn in remote pockets of the park. Federal officials have not yet provided details on their response to lawmakers.
item.content:encoded:
The Dragon Bravo fire continues to burn in remote pockets of the park. Federal officials have not yet provided details on their response to lawmakers.

(Image credit: A. Sage-Morris)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Heinsius
